snippet: President Obama signed a bill into law on Friday that would prohibit anyone who has engaged in espionage or terrorism against the United States from obtaining a visa to enter the country as a representative to the United Nations.
abstract: Pres Obama signs bill into law that will prohibit anyone who has engaged in espionage or terrorism against United States from obtaining visa to enter country as representative to United Nations; Congress passed bill after Iran named Hamid Aboutalebi, who was involved in American hostage crisis in 1979, as its ambassador to UN.
lead_paragraph: President Obama signed a bill into law on Friday that would prohibit anyone who has engaged in espionage or terrorism against the United States from obtaining a visa to enter the country as a representative to the United Nations.

headline.main: Obama Signs Bill That Bars Iran’s Envoy
headline.print_headline: Obama Signs Bill That Bars Iran’s Envoy
